summary.para: Abandons all active storyboards.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Calling this method is equivalent to calling the method for each active storyboard.
A storyboard is considered active if a call to the method returns
or .

summary.para: Creates a new animation variable.

param.name: initialValue
param.para: The initial value for the animation variable.

param.name: variable
param.para: The new animation variable.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: The initial value of an animation variable is specified when the variable is created. After an animation variable is created, its value cannot be changed directly; it must be updated through the animation manager.

An animation variable is typically created to represent each visual characteristic that is to be animated. For example, an application might create two animation variables for the X and Y coordinates of an object that can move freely within a window.

summary.para: Creates a new animation variable for each specified dimension.

param.name: initialValue
param.para: A vector (of size cDimension) of initial values for the animation variable.

param.name: cDimension
param.para: The number of dimensions that require animated values. This parameter specifies the number of values listed in initialValue.

param.name: variable
param.para: The new animation variable.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: The initial value of an animation variable is specified when the variable is created. After an animation variable is created, its value cannot be changed directly; it must be updated through the animation manager.

An animation variable is typically created to represent each visual characteristic that is to be animated. For example, an application might create three animation variables for the X, Y, and Z coordinates of an object that can move freely within a three-dimensional space.

summary.para: Creates a new storyboard.

param.name: storyboard
param.para: The new storyboard.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

summary.para: Retrieves an estimate of the time interval before the next animation event.

param.name: seconds
param.para: The estimated time, in seconds.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

summary.para: Finishes all active storyboards within the specified time interval.

param.name: completionDeadline
param.para: The maximum time interval during which all storyboards must be finished.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Calling the FinishAllStoryboards method ensures that all active storyboards finish within the specified completion deadline. If a storyboard is scheduled to play past the deadline, it is compressed.
A storyboard is considered active if a call to the method returns
or .

summary.para: Gets the status of the animation manager.

param.name: status
param.para: The status of the animation manager.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

summary.para: Gets the storyboard with the specified tag.

param.name: object
param.para: The object portion of the tag. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: id
param.para: The identifier portion of the tag.

param.name: storyboard
param.para: The storyboard that matches the specified tag, or NULL if no match is found.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: A tag is a pairing of an integer identifier (id) with a COM object (object). An application can use tags to identify animation variables and storyboards. NULL is a valid object component of a tag; therefore, the object parameter can be NULL.
Tags are not necessarily unique; this method returns UI_E_AMBIGUOUS_MATCH if more than one storyboard exists with the specified tag.

summary.para: Gets the animation variable with the specified tag.

param.name: object
param.para: The object portion of the tag. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: id
param.para: The identifier portion of the tag.

param.name: variable
param.para: The animation variable that matches the specified tag, or NULL if no match is found.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: A tag is a pairing of an integer identifier (id) with a COM object (object). An application can use tags to identify animation variables and storyboards. NULL is a valid object component of a tag; therefore, the object parameter can be NULL.
Tags are not necessarily unique; this method returns UI_E_AMBIGUOUS_MATCH if more than one animation variable exists with the specified tag.

summary.para: Pauses all animations.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: When an animation manager is paused, its status is set to .

summary.para: Resumes all animations.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: When an animation manager is resumed, and at least one animation is currently scheduled or playing, its status is set to .

summary.para: Creates and schedules a single-transition storyboard.

param.name: variable
param.para: The animation variable.

param.name: transition
param.para: A transition to be applied to the animation variable.

param.name: timeNow
param.para: The current system time.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: This method schedules a new storyboard by creating the storyboard, applying the specified transition to the specified variable, and then scheduling the storyboard.

summary.para: Sets the animation mode.

param.name: mode
param.para: The animation mode.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Use this method to enable or disable animation globally. While animation is disabled, all storyboards finish immediately when they are scheduled. The default mode is , which lets Windows decide when to enable or disable animation in the application.

summary.para: Sets the priority comparison handler that determines whether a scheduled storyboard can be canceled.

param.name: comparison
param.para: The priority comparison handler for cancelation.
The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL. See Remarks for more info.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Setting a priority comparison handler with this method enables the application to indicate when scheduling conflicts can be resolved by canceling storyboards.

A scheduled storyboard can be canceled only if it hasn't started playing and the priority comparison object registered with this method returns S_OK. Canceled storyboards are completely removed from the schedule.

Passing NULL for the comparison parameter causes Windows Animation to release its reference to any priority comparison handler object that you passed in earlier. This technique can be essential for breaking reference cycles without having to call the method.

summary.para: Sets the priority comparison handler that determines whether a scheduled storyboard can be compressed.

param.name: comparison
param.para: The priority comparison handler for compression.
The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL. See Remarks for more info.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Setting a priority comparison handler with this method enables the application to indicate when scheduling conflicts can be resolved by compressing the scheduled storyboard and any other storyboards animating the same variables.

A storyboard can be compressed only if the priority comparison object registered with this method returns S_OK for all the other scheduled storyboards that will be affected by compression. When the storyboards are compressed, time is temporarily accelerated for affected storyboards, so they play faster.

Passing NULL for the comparison parameter causes Windows Animation to release its reference to any handler object that you passed in earlier. This technique can be essential for breaking reference cycles without having to call the method.

summary.para: Sets the priority comparison handler that determines whether a scheduled storyboard can be concluded.

param.name: comparison
param.para: The priority comparison handler for conclusion. The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL. See Remarks for more info.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Setting a priority comparison handler with this method enables the application to indicate when scheduling conflicts can be resolved by concluding the scheduled storyboard.

A scheduled storyboard can be concluded only if it contains a loop with a repetition count of UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY and the priority comparison object registered with this method returns S_OK. If the storyboard is concluded, the current repetition of the loop completes, and the rest of the storyboard then plays.

Passing NULL for the comparison parameter causes Windows Animation to release its reference to any handler object that you passed in earlier. This technique can be essential for breaking reference cycles without having to call the method.

summary.para: Sets the default acceptable animation delay. This is the length of time that may pass before storyboards begin.

param.name: delay
param.para: The default delay. This parameter can be a positive value, or UI_ANIMATION_SECONDS_EVENTUALLY (-1) to indicate that any finite delay is acceptable.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: For Windows Animation to schedule a storyboard successfully, the storyboard must begin before the longest acceptable delay has elapsed. Windows Animation determines this delay in the following order: the delay value set by calling for this specific storyboard, the delay value set by calling this method, or 0.0 if neither method has been called.

summary.para: Specifies a handler for animation manager status updates.

param.name: handler
param.para: The event handler to be called when the status of the animation manager changes.
The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL. See Remarks for more info.

param.name: fRegisterForNextAnimationEvent
param.para: If TRUE, specifies that will incorporate handler into its estimate of the time interval until the next animation event. No default value.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Passing NULL for the handler parameter causes Windows Animation to release its reference to any handler object that you passed in earlier. This technique can be essential for breaking reference cycles without having to call the method.

summary.para: Sets the priority comparison handler that determines whether a scheduled storyboard can be trimmed.

param.name: comparison
param.para: The priority comparison handler for trimming.
The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL.
See Remarks for more info.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Setting a priority comparison handler with this method enables the application to indicate when scheduling conflicts can be resolved by trimming the scheduled storyboard.

A scheduled storyboard can be trimmed only if the priority comparison object registered with this method returns S_OK. If the new storyboard trims the scheduled storyboard, the scheduled storyboard can no longer affect a variable after the new storyboard begins to animate that variable.

Passing NULL for the comparison parameter causes Windows Animation to release its reference to any handler object that you passed in earlier. This technique can be essential for breaking reference cycles without having to call the method.

summary.para: Shuts down the animation manager and all its associated objects.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Calling this method directs the animation manager, and all the objects it created, to release all their pointers to other objects. After IUIAnimationManager2.Shutdown has been called, no other methods may be called on the animation manager or on any objects that it created. An application can call this method to clean up if there is any possibility that the application has introduced a reference cycle that includes some animation objects.

summary.para: Updates the values of all animation variables.

param.name: timeNow
param.para: The current system time. This parameter must be greater than or equal to 0.0.

param.name: updateResult
param.para: The result of the update. You can omit this parameter from calls to this method.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: Calling this method advances the animation manager to timeNow, changes the status of all storyboards as necessary, and updates any animation variables to appropriate interpolated values. If the animation manager is paused, no storyboards or variables are updated. If the animation mode is , all scheduled storyboards finish playing immediately. If the values of any variables change during this call, the value of updateResult is ; otherwise, it is .

summary.para: Defines an animation manager, which provides a central interface for creating and managing animations in multiple dimensions.
